Package gov.tak.platform.widgets.opengl

Class GLFinalApproachHeading

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.tak.platform.widgets.opengl.GLFinalApproachHeading
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HitTestControl, MapControl, GLMapRenderable2, Releasable, FinalApproachHeading.OnPropertyChangedListener
    public final class GLFinalApproachHeading
extends java.lang.Object
implements GLMapRenderable2, FinalApproachHeading.OnPropertyChangedListener, Releasable, HitTestControl
    A GLMapWidget class that will display an arrow representing the Final Attack Heading towards a targeted IP and with an offset from some designator point. The widget will also display a cone that represents the offset width from the heading on each side. The final attack heading text value will be displayed above the heading arrow, as well as the text heading values of the cone's sides.

      • draw

        public void draw​(GLMapView view,
                 int pass)
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Renders the content in the current EGL context for the given view. Initialization of the renderer may occur following instantiation or a prior call to GLMapRenderable2.release().

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        Specified by:
        draw in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Parameters:
        view - The current view
        pass - The render pass being executed during this invocation. The value will be the bitwise-OR of any of the flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Only content valid for the specified pass should be rendered.

      • release

        public void release()
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Releases any resources allocated by the renderable as a result of the invocation of the #draw(GLMapView) method. This method will be invoked when a renderable that was previously being rendered is no longer eligible for rendering (e.g. a tile that is no longer in view on the map). The renderable may be reinitialized and rendered via a subsequent call to #draw(GLMapView) in the future.

        This method is ALWAYS invoked on the GL thread.

        Specified by:
        release in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Specified by:
        release in interface Releasable

      • getRenderPass

        public int getRenderPass()
        Description copied from interface: GLMapRenderable2
        Returns a flag indicating the render passes that this renderable contains content for. The returned value should be the bitwise-OR of any of the following flags:
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SURFACE
        • GLMapView.RENDER_PASS_SPRITES
        Specified by:
        getRenderPass in interface GLMapRenderable2
        Returns:
        A flag indicating the render passes that this renderable contains content for
